lines.content: I used AI (mostly ChatGPT and Claude) to validate whether my code structure was correct.
1. I write pseudocode or English descriptions outlining the code and its structural placement.
2. I input these into GPT and Claude to ask whether my abstraction and structure are sound.
3. I then implement the code myself.
4. I trust AI tools for generating Javadoc and ensuring adherence to coding standards.

5. I don‚Äôt usually trust the code generated by GPT because it doesn‚Äôt have full context of what I‚Äôm building. It sometimes makes incorrect assumptions or overcomplicates the logic by adding excessive guard clauses‚Äîeven when I already have guard functions wrapping the logic.
6. I also use AI to correct grammar in this documentation.
7. I use AI to help design GUI layouts and component interactions, especially for early-stage prototyping and usability ideas.
8. I use AI to help write JUnit test code‚Äîespecially for generating test scaffolding, edge case coverage, and verifying expected behavior.
9. I use AI to help fix wording and grammar in the User Guide, making it clearer and more professional.
- Validating abstractions and structure early saved time during implementation.
- Javadoc generation and coding standard suggestions were consistently helpful.
- Grammar correction was fast and accurate.
- Generated code often lacked contextual awareness and introduced unnecessary complexity.
- Guard logic was frequently redundant due to misunderstanding of existing safeguards.
- Estimated **10‚Äì15%** reduction in time spent on documentation and structural validation.
- Minimal time saved on actual code generation due to manual rewrites.
- Avoided time-consuming rewrites by consulting AI early to confirm structural correctness.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Stewie_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Stewie.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Stewie.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

Stewie is a text-based GUI personal assistant that helps you manage your day.
>*"Mom, mom, mom, mommy, mom, mom, mom..." ‚Äì Stewie*
Displays the current list of tasks.
Here‚Äôs what you‚Äôve got piling up:
Marks the task at the given index as done.
Behold! I've declared this paltry task complete.
Don't get cocky. You still have a long way to go.
Marks the task at the given index as **not done**.
You're toying with me! I've marked this back as incomplete.
Don't think for a second I'll forget this betrayal.
I've scribbled down your little task:
Now, do try to keep up, won't you?
*[HH:mm] is optional. If you omit it, the deadline will default to 00:00.*
I've scribbled down your little task:
Now, do try to keep up, won't you?
*[HH:mm] is optional. If you omit it, the deadline will default to 00:00.*
I've scribbled down your little task:
Now, do try to keep up, won't you?
Deletes the task at the given index.
Poof! Begone with you, you insignificant little undertaking!
Don't get cocky. You still have a long way to go.
Searches for tasks containing the keyword.
Hmph! Here are the pathetic, insignificant plans that you requested.
Updates the task at the given index with new details.
*[HH:mm] is optional. If you omit it, the deadline will default to 00:00.*
Oh, rejoice! I've altered your little task:
Try not to screw it up this time.
Finally, you're leaving. Do try not to get lost on the way out.
